header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.topics: Photos, Facebook, Phones, A recent visit to Buckfast Abbey, Suggestions for future trips, Cruises, Insurance David Cameron and tax avoidance Medical anecdotes Voting Car troubles
header.activity: Close family chatting about upcoming trips and current affairs
header.conv_type: Discussing, explaining, inviting, anecdote telling, making arrangements, telling jokes

speaker.fls: Spanish -- level unspecified; Japanese -- level unspecified

dear you probably got fiddled the last few years

you should stay on the phone I'll go and ask my doctor

and and he was very good because

yes cos he's lied as well now hasn't he?

so people were fine about that and then he said I don't have any shares in that company which is true because he sold them but he didn't tell them that
and now it's turned out he's profited from the arrangement after his father died so he was responsible for that
whether it was illegal I suppose is the next question
well cos a lot of these things are not illegal are they?
but it's a grey area isn't it?
but then considering he's the one saying he wants to close down all these loop holes
that's what's outrageous about it cos he's the one benefiting
yeah it's quite disappointing isn't it all this?
yes I mean the prime minister you expect him to know a few things don't you?
that's right cos he's the one saying we need to shut down all these
you know they may be legal but it's not ethical and then he's got caught in the same thing
he could have to resign over that actually if it gets big enough

and do you get paid more for that?
no so it's a flat rate a hundred pounds

yes if it's normally only well what's that? say ten eleven twelve one two so it's about four and a half hours is what they expe maybe five hours say
